com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read

Class FixedWidthTextTableReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.AbstractTableReader
      • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.AbstractSubTableReader
        • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.FileTableReader
          • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.TextFileTableReader<java.lang.String>
            • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.FixedWidthTextTableReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SubTableReader, TableReader

    public class FixedWidthTextTableReader
extends TextFileTableReader<java.lang.String>
    The FixedWidthTextTableReader is used to read text files with fixed width columns. The constructors require either the individual column widths to be specified or he column (start) positions and line length.

      • FixedWidthTextTableReader

        public FixedWidthTextTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         java.lang.String tableName,
                         int[] widths)
        Constructor specifying the file and table name, as well as column widths, for the fixed width data.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the csv data file.
        tableName - The name to use for the table.
        widths - The widths (in characters) for each column in the table file.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if filePath was not found.

      • FixedWidthTextTableReader

        public FixedWidthTextTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         int[] widths)
        Constructor specifying the file name, as well as column widths, for the fixed width data. The file name (excluding directories) will be used as the table name.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the csv data file.
        widths - The widths (in characters) for each column in the table file.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if filePath was not found.

      • FixedWidthTextTableReader

        public FixedWidthTextTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         java.lang.String tableName,
                         int[] positions,
                         int lineLength)
        Constructor specifying the file and table name, as well as column positions and line length, for the fixed width data.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the csv data file.
        tableName - The name to use for the table.
        positions - The (0-based) line positions of the start of each column.
        lineLength - The length of each line.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if filePath was not found.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if positions does not start at 0, if the elements of positions are not in ascending order, or if the last position in positions is not less than lineLength.

      • FixedWidthTextTableReader

        public FixedWidthTextTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         int[] positions,
                         int lineLength)
        Constructor specifying the file name, as well as column positions and line length, for the fixed width data.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the csv data file.
        positions - The (0-based) line positions of the start of each column
        lineLength - The length of each line.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if filePath was not found.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if positions does not start at 0, if the elements of positions are not in ascending order, or if the last position in positions is not less than lineLength.

      • FixedWidthTextTableReader

        public FixedWidthTextTableReader(java.lang.String filePath,
                         java.lang.String tableName)
        Constructor specifying the file and table name in which an attempt will be made to infer the column widths. This inference is very simple and will probably only work on the simplest of tables. In a broad sense, it follows these rules:
        • Spaces are assumed to be padding in the front of columns.
        • Numbers are held together as single columns - so no numeric text is inferred.
        • The smallest line length determines the width used column parser.
        • Column widths for all rows are inferred, and these inferred widths are merged (the merging retains all discovered column delimitation points).
        • The smallest line length determines the width used column parser.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the csv data file.
        tableName - The name to use for the table.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if filePath was not found.

      • FixedWidthTextTableReader

        public FixedWidthTextTableReader(java.lang.String filePath)
        Constructor specifying the file name in which an attempt will be made to infer the column widths. The file name (excluding directories) will be used as the table name.This inference is very simple and will probably only work on the simplest of tables. It is described in FixedWidthTextTableReader(String, String).
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the csv data file.
        Throws:
        RuntimeIOException - if filePath was not found.
